intro: Oxytropis giraldii, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often small and hairy, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Oxytropis giraldii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native range.
